channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Enhancing MMDiT-Based Text-to-Image Models for Similar Subject Generation
item.description: Despite significant improvements, we observe that semantic ambiguity persists when generating multiple similar subjects, as the guidance provided by overlap loss is not explicit enough.

item.title: Evaluating and Improving the Robustness of Security Attack Detectors Generated by LLMs
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly used in software development to generate functions, such as attack detectors, that implement security requirements.

item.title: Vision Mamba Distillation for Low-resolution Fine-grained Image Classification
item.description: Low-resolution fine-grained image classification has recently made significant progress, largely thanks to the super-resolution techniques and knowledge distillation methods.

item.title: Deep Fourier-embedded Network for Bi-modal Salient Object Detection
item.description: The rapid development of deep learning provides a significant improvement of salient object detection combining both RGB and thermal images.

item.title: Aligning Knowledge Concepts to Whole Slide Images for Precise Histopathology Image Analysis
item.description: Due to the large size and lack of fine-grained annotation, Whole Slide Images (WSIs) analysis is commonly approached as a Multiple Instance Learning (MIL) problem.

item.title: RITA: Automatic Framework for Designing of Resilient IoT Applications
item.description: Designing resilient Internet of Things (IoT) systems requires i) identification of IoT Critical Objects (ICOs) such as services, devices, and resources, ii) threat analysis, and iii) mitigation strategy selection.

item.title: ChatRex: Taming Multimodal LLM for Joint Perception and Understanding
item.description: From the data perspective, we build a fully automated data engine and construct the Rexverse-2M dataset which possesses multiple granularities to support the joint training of perception and understanding.

item.title: Scalable Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning with Fairness Guarantees using Lorenz Dominance
item.description: Multi-Objective Reinforcement Learning (MORL) aims to learn a set of policies that optimize trade-offs between multiple, often conflicting objectives.

item.title: A Runtime-Adaptive Transformer Neural Network Accelerator on FPGAs
item.description: Additionally, it achieves a speedup of 1. 7 to 2. 25$\times$ compared to some state-of-the-art FPGA-based accelerators.

item.title: From Open Vocabulary to Open World: Teaching Vision Language Models to Detect Novel Objects
item.description: To address theses limitations, we propose a framework that enables OVD models to operate in open world settings, by identifying and incrementally learning novel objects.

item.title: HUPE: Heuristic Underwater Perceptual Enhancement with Semantic Collaborative Learning
item.description: To strike a balance between visual quality and application, we propose a heuristic invertible network for underwater perception enhancement, dubbed HUPE, which enhances visual quality and demonstrates flexibility in handling other downstream tasks.

item.title: Simulating Tabular Datasets through LLMs to Rapidly Explore Hypotheses about Real-World Entities
item.description: Do horror writers have worse childhoods than other writers?

item.title: Spectral-Spatial Transformer with Active Transfer Learning for Hyperspectral Image Classification
item.description: In this study, we propose a novel multi-stage active transfer learning (ATL) framework that integrates a Spatial-Spectral Transformer (SST) with an active learning process for efficient HSI classification.

item.title: MM-Path: Multi-modal, Multi-granularity Path Representation Learning -- Extended Version
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Multi-modal, Multi-granularity Path Representation Learning Framework (MM-Path), which can learn a generic path representation by integrating modalities from both road paths and image paths.

item.title: Draft Model Knows When to Stop: A Self-Verification Length Policy for Speculative Decoding
item.description: Speculative Decoding (SD) has become an important technique in accelerating the inference speed of large language models.

item.title: Helvipad: A Real-World Dataset for Omnidirectional Stereo Depth Estimation
item.description: Despite considerable progress in stereo depth estimation, omnidirectional imaging remains underexplored, mainly due to the lack of appropriate data.

item.title: QuaLLM-Health: An Adaptation of an LLM-Based Framework for Quantitative Data Extraction from Online Health Discussions
item.description: In this work, we present an adapted framework from QuaLLM into QuaLLM-Health for extracting clinically relevant quantitative data from Reddit discussions about glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) receptor agonists using large language models (LLMs).

item.title: Training Noise Token Pruning
item.description: In the present work we present Training Noise Token (TNT) Pruning for vision transformers.

item.title: Training and Evaluating Language Models with Template-based Data Generation
item.description: To address this limitation, we introduce Template-based Data Generation (TDG), a novel approach that leverages LLMs (GPT-4) to automatically generate parameterized meta-templates, which are then used to synthesize a vast array of high-quality problems and solutions.

item.title: Adaptive Blind All-in-One Image Restoration
item.description: Blind all-in-one image restoration models aim to recover a high-quality image from an input degraded with unknown distortions.

item.title: TimeMarker: A Versatile Video-LLM for Long and Short Video Understanding with Superior Temporal Localization Ability
item.description: Rapid development of large language models (LLMs) has significantly advanced multimodal large language models (LMMs), particularly in vision-language tasks.

item.title: GLS: Geometry-aware 3D Language Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Recently, 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) has achieved significant performance on indoor surface reconstruction and open-vocabulary segmentation.

item.title: Optimizing Multispectral Object Detection: A Bag of Tricks and Comprehensive Benchmarks
item.description: Multispectral object detection, utilizing RGB and TIR (thermal infrared) modalities, is widely recognized as a challenging task.

item.title: Surveying the space of descriptions of a composite system with machine learning
item.description: By integrating machine learning into a fine-grained information theoretic analysis of composite random variables, our framework opens a new avenues for probing the structure of real-world complex systems.

item.title: VideoLLM Knows When to Speak: Enhancing Time-Sensitive Video Comprehension with Video-Text Duet Interaction Format
item.description: We construct MMDuetIT, a video-text training dataset designed to adapt VideoLLMs to video-text duet interaction format.

item.title: Neural Surface Priors for Editable Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Unlike other methods, our pipeline allows modifications applied to the extracted mesh to be propagated to the proxy representation, from which we recover the updated parameters of the Gaussians.

item.title: RL for Mitigating Cascading Failures: Targeted Exploration via Sensitivity Factors
item.description: Electricity grid's resiliency and climate change strongly impact one another due to an array of technical and policy-related decisions that impact both.

item.title: Convolutional Neural Networks Do Work with Pre-Defined Filters
item.description: We present a novel class of Convolutional Neural Networks called Pre-defined Filter Convolutional Neural Networks (PFCNNs), where all nxn convolution kernels with n>1 are pre-defined and constant during training.

item.title: DuMapper: Towards Automatic Verification of Large-Scale POIs with Street Views at Baidu Maps
item.description: With the increased popularity of mobile devices, Web mapping services have become an indispensable tool in our daily lives.

item.title: Emergence of Self-Identity in AI: A Mathematical Framework and Empirical Study with Generative Large Language Models
item.description: This paper introduces a mathematical framework for defining and quantifying self-identity in artificial intelligence (AI) systems, addressing a critical gap in the theoretical foundations of artificial consciousness.

item.title: GeneQuery: A General QA-based Framework for Spatial Gene Expression Predictions from Histology Images
item.description: Gene expression profiling provides profound insights into molecular mechanisms, but its time-consuming and costly nature often presents significant challenges.

item.title: Isometry pursuit
item.description: Isometry pursuit is a convex algorithm for identifying orthonormal column-submatrices of wide matrices.

item.title: AdaVLN: Towards Visual Language Navigation in Continuous Indoor Environments with Moving Humans
item.description: Visual Language Navigation is a task that challenges robots to navigate in realistic environments based on natural language instructions.

item.title: Dual-Representation Interaction Driven Image Quality Assessment with Restoration Assistance
item.description: To address this issue, we first introduce the DRI method to obtain degradation vectors and quality vectors of images, which separately model the degradation and quality information of low-quality images.

item.title: Emergenet: A Digital Twin of Sequence Evolution for Scalable Emergence Risk Assessment of Animal Influenza A Strains
item.description: Despite having triggered devastating pandemics in the past, our ability to quantitatively assess the emergence potential of individual strains of animal influenza viruses remains limited.

item.title: Using Large Language Models for Expert Prior Elicitation in Predictive Modelling
item.description: This study proposes using LLMs to elicit expert prior distributions for predictive models.

item.title: Distractor-free Generalizable 3D Gaussian Splatting
item.description: To achieve these objectives, DGGS introduces a scene-agnostic reference-based mask prediction and refinement methodology during training phase, coupled with a training view selection strategy, effectively improving distractor prediction accuracy and training stability.

item.title: cWDM: Conditional Wavelet Diffusion Models for Cross-Modality 3D Medical Image Synthesis
item.description: This paper contributes to the "BraTS 2024 Brain MR Image Synthesis Challenge" and presents a conditional Wavelet Diffusion Model (cWDM) for directly solving a paired image-to-image translation task on high-resolution volumes.

item.title: TabulaX: Leveraging Large Language Models for Multi-Class Table Transformations
item.description: The integration of tabular data from diverse sources is often hindered by inconsistencies in formatting and representation, posing significant challenges for data analysts and personal digital assistants.

item.title: MTS-UNMixers: Multivariate Time Series Forecasting via Channel-Time Dual Unmixing
item.description: Specifically, MTS-UNMixers represent sequences over time as a mixture of multiple trends and cycles, with the time-correlated representation coefficients shared across both historical and future time periods.

item.title: A Novel Word Pair-based Gaussian Sentence Similarity Algorithm For Bengali Extractive Text Summarization
item.description: Here, we propose a novel Word pair-based Gaussian Sentence Similarity (WGSS) algorithm for calculating the semantic relation between two sentences.

item.title: Can LLMs be Good Graph Judger for Knowledge Graph Construction?
item.description: We seek to utilize the capacity of LLMs to function as a graph judger, a capability superior to their role only as a predictor for KG construction problems.

item.title: ReC-TTT: Contrastive Feature Reconstruction for Test-Time Training
item.description: Test-Time Training (TTT) was proposed as an effective solution to this issue, which increases the generalization ability of trained models by adding an auxiliary task at train time and then using its loss at test time to adapt the model.

item.title: OpenAD: Open-World Autonomous Driving Benchmark for 3D Object Detection
item.description: Moreover, we propose a vision-centric 3D open-world object detection baseline and further introduce an ensemble method by fusing general and specialized models to address the issue of lower precision in existing open-world methods for the OpenAD benchmark.

item.title: APT: Architectural Planning and Text-to-Blueprint Construction Using Large Language Models for Open-World Agents
item.description: We present APT, an advanced Large Language Model (LLM)-driven framework that enables autonomous agents to construct complex and creative structures within the Minecraft environment.

item.title: Omegance: A Single Parameter for Various Granularities in Diffusion-Based Synthesis
item.description: In this work, we introduce a single parameter $\omega$, to effectively control granularity in diffusion-based synthesis.

item.title: Box for Mask and Mask for Box: weak losses for multi-task partially supervised learning
item.description: Making use of one task's information to train the other would be beneficial for multi-task partially supervised learning where each training example is annotated only for a single task, having the potential to expand training sets with different-task datasets.

item.title: X-MeshGraphNet: Scalable Multi-Scale Graph Neural Networks for Physics Simulation
item.description: In this work, we introduce X-MeshGraphNet, a scalable, multi-scale extension of MeshGraphNet designed to address these challenges.

item.title: Disentangled Interpretable Representation for Efficient Long-term Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Existing deep learning and linear models often suffer from excessive parameter complexity and lack intuitive interpretability.

item.title: Learning Explainable Treatment Policies with Clinician-Informed Representations: A Practical Approach
item.description: Our main contribution is to reveal the importance of clinical domain knowledge in developing state and action representations for effective, efficient, and interpretable targeting policies.
